name: Pat Neusbaum
descriptions: Pat Neusbaum is one of the inhabitants of Vault 112 and part of the Tranquility Lane virtual reality simulation, found in Fallout 3.

The proud all-American wife of George Neusbaum and mother of Timmy, Pat is resident 375 of Vault 112, hooked up at lounger 37 for over 200 years. After numerous other simulations, she was finally placed by Stanislaus Braun, her tormentor, in the role of a shy housewife, fretting over her son, though unable to offer more than platitudes.

Old Lady Dithers tops her list of worries, as she considers her to be crazy and a potential bad influence on Timmy. However, rather than confront her directly, she wants her husband to break up any potential contact between the two.
Her vitals in 2277 are 82 bpm, 121/80 mmHG, 36.6°C or 97.9°F, with 19 breaths per minute and nominal stress levels: Perfectly normal for a woman her age.

topics.response_text: Have you talked to Betty? I think she's waiting for you.
It sure is. But it always is here!

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about the neighborhood?
topics.response_text: Well, George and I have been here... why, as long as I can remember.
No sweetie, I haven't. I'm sure he'll come looking for you before long, though.

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about Mabel Henderson?
topics.response_text: Mabel? She's nice enough, I suppose. A bit of a gossip, maybe. And she never seemed too fond of my boy Timmy.

topics.topic_text: Can you tell me anything about the Rockwells' marriage?
topics.response_text: I don't know what sort of thing you'd want to hear about... There was that one time Janet waved a rolling pin at Martha...

topics.topic_text: This is a pretty convincing simulation...
topics.response_text: What? Oh, sweetie. Maybe you should just run along and play.

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about Timmy Neusbaum?
topics.response_text: Timmy? Oh, he's a good boy. George and I are so proud of him.

conversation.response_text: George, I thought I told you to have a talk with Timmy about Old Lady Dithers.
Oh, stop it. You know I don't trust that woman one bit.
It's not funny, George. I'm not joking around.{annoyed, snapping}
Well I'm not going to go running off to hear what she has to say today. Now find something useful to do.
She's been talking to Timmy again. I want him to stay away from her. She's nuts, and she shouldn't be anywhere near him.
